questions.title: TAIVote: Taiwan AI-policy Vote
questions.description: Hello, welcome to 'TAIVote: Taiwan AI-policy Vote.' Please answer the following questions based on your thoughts. Your opinions will help shape a more representative AI Basic Law. Let's work together for a better Taiwan, and thank you again for your participation! (Translated by AI)
questions.submitDescription: Voting is complete! Please click the button below to submit your choices. Note: You can only submit your vote once. If you need to modify your answers, use the back button in the top left to make changes. Thank you for your participation!

section1.title: 1. Personal Opinions on AI
section1.question1: At this stage, do you think it is more important for the Taiwan government to 'Encourage AI Innovation' or 'Regulate AI'?
section1.question2: Who do you think should own the copyright of AI-generated content?
options2: The developer/company of the AI system
The individual/organization using the AI system
The original data author used to train the AI
section1.question3: How do you think 'AI Medical Diagnostic Systems' should be regulated?
options3: It should only be used as an auxiliary tool, with the final decision made by doctors
It can make independent diagnoses but must be supervised by human doctors
section1.question4: How should the application of AI in the 'job market' be regulated?
options4: AI should be restricted from replacing human jobs
No intervention, let the market develop freely

section2.title: 2. Opinions on the Development of AI in Taiwan
section2.question1: Do you support Taiwan enacting an 'AI Basic Law' to regulate the development and application of AI?
section2.question2: Do you support the Ministry of Education allocating a budget for 'AI Equality' to cover AI-related training courses and software fees for teachers and students at all levels?
section2.question3: Do you support the Taiwan government opening public sector and publicly funded content for AI training without liability or cost?
section2.question4: Do you support the Taiwan government expanding or amending copyright laws, similar to Japan, to allow AI to use all local Taiwanese corpora, images, and videos for training without authorization and free of charge?
section2.question5: Do you think decisions made by AI systems should be transparent and explainable to humans?
section2.question6: 'Sovereign AI' aims to reduce reliance on external technologies and supply chains, ensuring full control and autonomy over AI development, data access, and decision-making processes. Do you support the Taiwan government making the development mechanisms, budget, and processes for 'Sovereign AI' transparent and involving public participation?
section2.question7: Do you support the Taiwan government collaborating with international third parties for 'AI Ethics and Safety Assessments'?
section2.question8: Do you support Taiwan participating in establishing an 'International AI Transparency Organization' to help all countries address AI development and safety issues? (Reference video: https://youtu.be/GFFr42xaNtg)

section3.title: 3. Opinions on the Direction and Content of Taiwan's 'AI Basic Law'
section3.question1: Do you think this law should promote AI industry innovation while ensuring that employment opportunities are not significantly displaced?
section3.question2: Do you agree that this law should regulate and review high-risk AI applications?
section3.question3: Do you agree that this law should enhance protection for personal privacy and data security in AI systems?
section3.question4: Do you think this law should require AI technologies to follow ethical standards to avoid bias and discrimination?
section3.question5: Do you support this law establishing transparent mechanisms to allow the public to understand how AI systems make decisions?
section3.question6: Do you support this law requiring the Taiwan government to invest in AI education and training to improve the public's AI literacy?
section3.question7: Do you agree that this law should encourage the application of AI technologies in public services such as healthcare and education?
section3.question8: Do you support this law requiring the Taiwan government to participate in international cooperation to jointly set standards and regulations for AI development?
section3.question9: Do you agree that this law should prioritize environmental sustainability and social responsibility in AI development?
